title: Chicken and Biscuits
requires: Biscuits as made for the “Williamsburg Chicken and Biscuits” recipe, see the “Breads, Cakes, and Cookies” folder.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350° F, ten minutes before casserole is to go in.
Simmer the chicken, celery, and onion in 3 to 4 cups of water with the salt and pepper until the chicken is done.  Discard the skin and bones, and cut the chicken into medium-size pieces.
Reduce the stock to 2 cups by boiling and then cool and remove the excess fat.  Thicken with the flour mixed with 6 tablespoons of water.  Add salt and pepper to taste.
Arrange the chicken pieces in the bottom of a 12 by 8 by 2 inch baking; or 2-quart casserole, dish.  Pour the gravy over the chicken and let it cool.
Place the biscuits on top of the cooled chicken mixture and bake it at 350° F. for 25 to 30 minutes; or, until the biscuits are done.
source: The Williamsburg Cookbook, Updated 1975 Edition, Published by The Colonial Williamsburg Foundation, Williamsburg, Virginia.
